item.title: Plz help my port fowarding + coder needed, u will b admin if u can help
item.dc:creator: @flamed_fury1 flamed fury1
item.description:
@flamed_fury1 wrote:

How do I set up a DMZ on my SpeedTouch 500/700 series router? To set up a DMZ refer to the Port Forwarding (Game and Application Sharing) sections of the SpeedTouch USer's Guide. For users with a fixed IP address it is possible to set a 1-to-1 static NAT entry to establish a DMZ...

Connect to an Ethernet port on your SpeedTouch. Open a telnet session and login as the Administrator. Enter the command line:

:nat mapadd intf=Internet type=nat outside_addr=xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx inside_addr=yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy

:firewall rule add chain=forward_level_Standard name=Allow_DMZ src=wan dstintf=lan dstip=yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy action=accept

where xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx is the static IP address of the WAN interface and yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy is the static IP address of the DMZ.

Note the:

refer to the Port Forwarding (Game and Application Sharing) sections of the SpeedTouch USer's Guide.

Read full topic
